On 22/01/06, Kent Beck <kentb@...> wrote:
> Another way to say th=
is is that we needed a Null Object to represent the case where there is no =
expected exception and you can't use null as a default value. Test.None is =
package scope, so it shouldn't be publicly accessible, or am I missing some=
thing?

It isn't packaged-scope... in Java, members of an interface always
=
have the same visibility as the interface itself (in this case,
public).
